meanings.definition: To cause (an event or situation, typically one that is bad or undesirable) to happen suddenly, unexpectedly, or prematurely.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside was precipitating my headache.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rain was precipitating flooding in the area.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected power outage was precipitating a candlelit dinner.
meanings.sent4: Her harsh words were precipitating a storm of emotions within him.
meanings.sent5: The sudden gust of wind was precipitating chaos in the park.

meanings.definition: To cause (a substance) to be deposited in solid form from a solution.
meanings.sent1: The cold temperature was precipitating snowflakes from the clouds.
meanings.sent2: The cooling lava was precipitating crystals in the rock.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient was precipitating a delicious sauce.
meanings.sent4: The slow cooling process was precipitating beautiful salt crystals.
meanings.sent5: The chemical reaction was precipitating colorful crystals in the beaker.
